Life Insurance - Manufacturers Life Insurance Company
Who is eligible: All permanent employees of the NAEB who work 30 or
more hours a week are automatically covered by life insurance according
to the following schedule*.
Amount of insurance
Annual salary over $15,000 ^2"(T~000
Annual salary from $10,000 to $15,000 10,000
Annual salary under $10,000 6,000
After age 65 there is a flat coverage, regardless of salary, of $2000.
Waiting period: Each new employee becomes eligible on the day he
completes 60 days of continuous employment.
Premium: Paid by the Association.
Conversion privilege: The employee has the privilege of converting
his insurance to an individual policy of life insurance if his
employment is terminated, provided written application for the
policy and payment of the first premium is made not later than 31
days after the date of termination of his employment.
Accidental Death and Dismemberment and Permanent Total
Disability - Queen Insurance Company of America
Who is eligible: All employees of the NAEB who work 30 or more hours
a week and members of the Board of Directors are automatically
covered by $50,000 insurance should they be killed or permanently
disabled while on NAEB business. (There is a specific exclusion
for accidental bodily injury incurred while flying in aircraft
personally owned.)
Waiting period: None for coverage. Benefits will be paid within
180 days following accident.
Premium: Paid by the Association.
Salary Continuation - Insurance Company of North America
Who is eligible: All permanent salaried employees regularly working
a minimum of 30 hours per week, except those employees who for health
reasons might be declared ineligible by the insurance company.
Waiting period: Each new employee becomes eligible on the day he
completes 90 days of continuous employment.
Premium: Paid by the Association.
